intro: Taraxacum ingens, commonly known as the giant dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant can grow up to 2 meters tall, making it one of the tallest species in the genus Taraxacum. Its leaves are typically broad, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are long and taproot-like. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites.
